Our mission is to improve the quality of life for America’s veterans, their families, active military, and our local community through a commitment to mutual helpfulness. We are passionate about supporting our veterans by offering resources, assistance, and a welcoming space for them to connect and gather. In addition, we actively engage with the Aurora community through various events and initiatives, helping to strengthen the bonds between veterans and their neighbors. We invite you to explore more about our post and our unwavering dedication to those who have served our country. Connect With Us The Four Pillars In 1919, The American Legion was founded on four pillars: Veterans Affairs & Rehabilitation, National Security, Americanism, and Children & Youth, Each of these pillars encompasses a variety of programs that benefit our nation’s veterans, its service members, their families, the youth of America and ordinary citizens. These programs make a difference in hundreds of thousands of lives each year. It’s who we are and what we do. Our Programs and Services At American Legion Post 1976, we offer a wide range of programs and services to support our veterans and their families, as well as our local community. VA Benefits Counseling: Our service officers provide free advice and assistance to any veteran, regardless of whether they are a member of our Post. We can help with VA benefits counseling, employment referrals, and more. Have a question? Get in touch Honor Bell Foundation Gallery American Legion Centennial Post 1976 15821 East Centretech Circle, Aurora, Colorado 80011, United States (720) 369-7844 Copyright © 2024 American Legion Centennial Post 1976 - All Rights Reserved. HOUSE RULES CONSTITUTION AND BYLAWS PURPLE HEART RESOLUTION American Legion Post 57 The American Legion myLegion Upcoming Events Patriot Day (9/11) 09/11/25 Bingo Day Session 09/11/25, 3:00PM Patriot Day Remembrance Ceremony 09/11/25, 6:00PM Bingo Night Session 09/11/25, 6:45PM Red Shirt Friday 09/12/25 See Full Calendar Download Welcome AMERICAN LEGION POST 57 LAKE CITY, FLORIDA Since our charter in (1920), our American Legion Post has been welcoming VETERANS from all branches of our Armed Forces. Today, we continue to welcome all military personnel serving our country. Joining our Post enables you to continue serving your God, Country and Community. Our mission is to implement the goals, aspirations, dreams, peace and blessings for our country, friends and families embodied in our preamble below. Post 57 Contact Information Office Phone: (386) 752-7776 Post Hours: Mon-Sun 11:00am to 10:00pm Email: americanlegion57@comcast.net Post Location 2602 SW Main Blvd Lake City FL 32025 Kitchen Phone: (386) 752-7260 Kitchen Hours: Lunch Monday - Friday 11:00am to 1:00pm Dinner Saturday - Thursday 4:00pm to 8:00pm Family Dinner Fridays Friday 5:30pm to 7:30pm © 2025 American Legion Post 57, 2602 SW Main Blvd, Lake City, Florida 32025, (386) 752-7776 Home Admin Sign In Password Reset Powered by Legionsites.com ✕ User Login Email: Password: Submit ✕ User Password Reset Please provide your user email: Submit

Post 57 Cobleskill ,Schoharie County, New York | The American Legion Centennial Celebration Join Renew Donate Sign In Vision Tools Post Tools Post Index News Videos Photos Post 57 Cobleskill ,Schoharie County, New York Home Post 57 Cobleskill ,Schoharie County, New York Post 57 Cobleskill ,Schoharie County, New York About This Post Post Namesake Ceremony to Commemorate the 100-Year Anniversary of the Funeral and Interment of Sergeant Fred L Stilson - American Legion Post 57 Namesake October 16, 2018 Interment October 16, 1918, at Cobleskill Rural Cemetery Cobleskill, New York Today we ... READ MORE What Makes this Post Unique Our Post 57 namesake Fred L Stilson has his name engraved on two WW l monuments in upstate NY. He enlisted in Schoharie County and had residency in Otsego County. Schoharie County monument located at Old Stone Fort, Schoharie NY READ MORE Share: Photos Wreaths Across America Placing of  Wreath by Post 57  First Vice Commander Wreaths Across America 2019 Cobleskill Veterans Day American Flags for Radez students Lt George W Snyder Decoration Day Ceremony Al Post 57 Honor Guard On My Honor Wreaths Across America....... Stilson Grave Site Decorated Saratoga National Cemetery Fred L Stilson honored All Photos HISTORY Jump to Decade 1910 1920 1940 1950 1960 2010 ​ 1910 Sgt. Fred L Stilson gravesite Nov 10, 1918 American Legion Post 57 namesake. Born 1896 Died 1918   Fort Ontario,Oswego N.Y. Located in the Cobleskill Rural Cemetery,old section G Full Story Charter for Fred L Stilson Post 57        June 13,1919 Jun 13, 1919 Original Charter for the Fred L Stilson Post 57  Cobleskill NY Dated  June 13 1919 I will be adding more close-ups of specific areas of the Charter. Or you can zoom in to read details. Full Story Post 57  June 13,1919 Charter Members ......  15 in all Jun 13, 1919 First Post Commander   Maynard K Van Deusen Full Story Formation of Post 57     Signers Section Jun 13, 1919 Dated June 13,1919 Full Story 1920 WWI Memorial at Cooperstown NY Jul 4, 1920 This WWI Memorial is located in Cooperstown NY. Decated long before the establishment of the Baseball Hall of Fame. It is located across the street from the Otesaga Hotel. Many hall of fame inducties have visited this site. Post 57 namesake Fred L Stilson is honored on the monument Full Story 1940 Thru War Bonds.... Fighter Plane Purchased Jun 6, 1944 Post 57 purchases War Bonds to help support War efforts. Note Post name painted on fuselage. Full Story Commander Joe Buckley..Plane Purchase Acknowledgement Jun 7, 1944 Letter from the War Finance Committee. Dated June 1944 Full Story Post 57.....American Legion Baseball Aug 1, 1948 This photo was taken in the late 1940s. Post 57 Commander Edward Lingenfelter is the team manager/coach. You can zoom out to read many of the names of the players. Full Story 1950 Dedication of Post 57 home on Legion Drive May 27, 1950 The new American Legion Post 57 home on Legion Drive in Cobleskill NY. As part of this event I will post articles and photos. Full Story Dedication Program Dias  Stilson Home May 27, 1951 The new Post 57 home was built on Legion Drive,Cobleskill NY. It is a very large brick structure. The main meeting room is located upstairs and the bar located downstairs. Unfortunately due to declining membership and increasing expenses the legion home had to be sold. The post was relocated to a much smaller building on MacArthur Ave in 1969. Today the former post building is the home of the Cobleskill Elks Lodge 2040. Post 57.. Full Story Memorial Day  Parade  1952 or 1953 May 30, 1952 This photo (1952 or 1953)captured the Cobleskill HS band marching from Center Park in Cobleskill NY to the Cobleskill Rural Cemetery. A Memorial Day service was held in the park and a service was also held at the cemetery. The march was about one mile long, all uphill. The Quarry St. bridge can be seen in background. Full Story 1960 The White House            Washington DC     August 1968 Aug 11, 1968 Post Commander Edward Lingenfelter recieved this correspondence from President Lyndon Johnson. Mr Whitney Shoemaker served as Public Affairs Director for the President. Full Story Honorary Life Members of Post 57 Jun 25, 1969 Pictured are the 1969  honorary life members of Post 57. Paid Up For Life did not exist at this time. Pictured are:  Frances Pratt   Lee Mackle   Henery Mattey   Ham Acheson   Charles Reghi William Bolcott   Fenton Mereness   Ed Lingenfelter   Maynard VanDuesen Full Story Post  57       50 Year Celebration Jun 30, 1969 Photo of news article about the Fred L Stilson Post 57 50th anniversary. Full Story Post  57       50 Year Celebration Jun 30, 1969 Photo of news article about the Fred L Stilson Post 57 50th anniversary. Full Story New Post 57 home on MacArthur Ave. Jun 30, 1969 This artical is part 2 of the move to our new Post 57 home on MacArthur Ave ,Cobleskill New York. Full Story Post 57    Home on MacArthur Ave. Jun 30, 1969 Our Post 57 home is still alive and running. We are the only Legion Post in Schoharie County with our own building. We are finally replacing the furnace installed in 1967. Full Story 2010 Fred L Stilson graveside ceremony Oct 16, 2018 This ceremony was held one hundred years to the exact date of Sergent Fred L Stilsons burial in Cobleskill Rural Cemetery. B-October 3,1896 / D-November 12,1918 Fort Ontario   Oswego,New York Fred L Stilson gave his last full measure of devotion at age 22 years. Full Story Fred L Stilson  headstone restoration May 26, 2019 The before and after photos show the results of the cleaning Stilsons headstone. We used a product called D2 . This is one way of honoring veteran buried in local cemeteries. Full Story Home Vision Tools News Videos Photos Calendar Copyright © 2025 - The American Legion

Day Remembrance Ceremony 09/11/25, 6:00PM Bingo Night Session 09/11/25, 6:45PM Red Shirt Friday 09/12/25 See Full Calendar Download TEXAS HOLD'EM Monday and Friday Starts at 7:00 PM OPEN TO MEMBERS AND GUESTS Sign up by 7:00 PM to receive early bird bonus of $2,000 chips Buy-in is $20 for $15,000 IN CHIPS Re-buys and add on $20 for 15,000 chips until the Blinds end at 2,000/4,000 An optional high hand pot is offered for $5 To win this pot you must have two (2) of the cards in your hand & win the hand (YOU DO NOT HAVE TO BE CALLED) You will receive $1,000 chips for every $5 in food purchased and $100 chips for each $1 spend on beverages or candy until the first break on Friday you will receive 5,000 in chips for dinner A ROYAL FLUSH Pot is offered and $10 will be added to it every Night we play To win this pot you must have two (2) of the cards in your hand (YOU DO NOT HAVE TO BE CALLED) If you have 2 ACE's in your hand and get beat the dealer will award you $5,000 in chips or the BIG Blind if it is larger If you have a full house or larger and get beat the dealer will award you $5,000 in chips or the BIG Blind if it is larger If you get a straight flush you will receive A BONUS OF  $10,000 in chips or the BIG Blind if it is larger ********************** On the 2nd & 3rd Fridays of each month a Texas Hold'em fundraiser is held in the main hall starting at 7:00 PM You will receive $5,000 in bonus chips to pre-register and another $5,000 in chips if you played in either fundraiser in the last 2 months You will also receive $5,000 in chips if you buy a dinner on Friday night (one per player) this game is open to public ********************** For more information on any of the above or to pre-register text Bob at (386) 344-1848 or send Email to bobtarlton@comcast.net © 2025 American Legion Post 57, 2602 SW Main Blvd, Lake City, Florida 32025, (386) 752-7776 Home Admin Sign In Password Reset Powered by Legionsites.com ✕ User Login Email: They are assigned to help guide, equip, and empower the pastors and staff at Journey Church to fulfill the mission and vision that God has uniquely given us. Our current Leadership Board members: Megan O’Connell, Jon Burgi, Lacey McNay, Ed Hatch, Amy Schlapper, Josh Thoreson. Click below to see upcoming meetings/events.  Join Us! Find out more Austin von Letkemann on the American legion Why You Should Belong Download PDF THE AMERICAN LEGION PREAMBLE "For God and Country, we associate ourselves together for the following purposes: To uphold and defend the Constitution of the United States of America; to maintain law and order; to foster and perpetuate a 100-percent Americanism; to preserve the memories and incidents of our associations in all wars; to inculcate a sense of individual obligation to the community, state and nation; to combat the autocracy of both the classes and the masses; to make right the master of might; to promote peace and good will on earth; to safeguard and transmit to posterity the principles of justice, freedom and democracy; to consecrate and sanctify our comradeship by our devotion to mutual helpfulness." Get in Touch Together, we make a difference Be a part of something bigger. With nearly 2 million members and 12,875 posts across the country, veterans find camaraderie and a home at The American Legion, where everyone is family. Join us as we continue to serve our communities and country. A regional liaison from the Internal Affairs & Membership Division is assigned to each region to assist people with their questions. These questions can be regarding procedures, processes and programs within The American Legion, how to start a new post or revitalize an existing one or general inquiries. American Legion Post 57 Back to Search American Legion Post 57 Categories Nonprofit Community Organizations 2602 SW Main Blvd , Lake City , FL , 32025 (386) 752-7776 Send Email Website About Since its charter in 1920, the American Legion Post has been welcoming veterans from all branches of the U.S. Armed Forces. Today, it continues to welcome all military personnel currently serving our country. Joining the Post enables individuals to continue serving God, Country, and Community. The American Legion is the largest U.S. veterans organization, with more than 1.6 million members who strengthen the nation through programs, services, and advocacy for those who have served in the U.S. Armed Forces, as well as for youth and communities.
